Package com.socrata

Base API package.The Socrata Java API allows the caller to do several types of operations against the Socrata service: The Consumer api is used for querying a Socrata dataset.

See: Description

Package com.socrata Description

Base API package.The Socrata Java API allows the caller to do several types of operations against the Socrata service:
  • The Consumer api is used for querying a Socrata dataset. The primary way to query is to use SoQL (the SODA Query Language)
  • The Producer api is used for adding/updating/removing rows to a dataset using the new SODA2 mechanisms (which don't require a publish)
  • The Importer api is used for adding a new datasets from CSVs
  • The DDL api is used for CRUD operations on datasets
  • The Workflow api defines a number of calls required for the workflow of publishing Datasets
In addition to the functions the API enabled, the Java implementation itself is broken into a few basic concepts:
  • APIs are the basic objects used to communicate with the Socrata servers. These objects contain all the methods the Socrata platform understands.
  • Model objects are the "nouns" of the API. They describe the objects that are passed to the Socrata server and from it. These can be anything from objects describing a dataset, to objects describing a query.
  • Exceptions are the objects that describe errors that occurred in the API
  • Builders are classes to help build model objects. These are utility functions to make using the API easier, but not required.
Soda2Producer producer = Soda2Producer.newProducer(url, userName, password, token); UpsertResult results = producer.upsertStream(UPDATE_DATA_SET, HttpLowLevel.CSV_TYPE, csvStream); if (results.errorCount()) throw SomeError;
